definition: to compose a piece of music

sentences.english: Only by one of our own music, lyrics of the song?
sentences.chinese: 一首仅能由我们自己谱曲，填词的歌？

sentences.english: So I started writing some lyrics and some songs.
sentences.chinese: 所以我开始自己作词谱曲一些歌曲。

sentences.english: You can start reading chapter 6 of Writing Music for Hit Songs.
sentences.chinese: 你可以从《为动听的歌谱曲》第六章读起。

sentences.english: Chad Kroeger wrote lyrics while the rest of the guys worked together on the music.
sentences.chinese: 查德负责作词，其他小伙子则一起谱曲。

sentences.english: You can start reading chapter 7 of Writing Music for Hit Songs.
sentences.chinese: 你可以从《为动听的歌谱曲》第七章读起。

sentences.english: First, you get the ability to render heavier comps .
sentences.chinese: 首先，你的能力，使重谱曲。

sentences.english: When I was writing it, I thought of a story for it.
sentences.chinese: 我在谱曲的时候，写了一段关于它的故事。

sentences.english: The inspiring music was composed by Beethoven.
sentences.chinese: 那鼓舞人心的音乐是贝多芬谱曲的。

sentences.english: Men wrote poems and songs in honour of women and their purity.
sentences.chinese: 男人会写诗或谱曲来荣耀女子并赞扬她们的纯洁。

sentences.english: He wrote scores for many hit musicals.
sentences.chinese: 他为许多风行一时的音乐片谱曲。

sentences.english: The composer is famous for his marvelous counterpoints.
sentences.chinese: 这位谱曲家以他杰出的对位旋律而闻名。
鲁塞尔还开始去尝试谱曲。

sentences.english: The great leader's exploits were emblazoned in song and story.
sentences.chinese: 伟大领袖的业绩被人们作诗谱曲加以吟颂。

sentences.english: Cale also uses electronic keyboards to compose.
sentences.chinese: 凯尔也用电子键盘谱曲。

definition: to compose a poem (to a given tune)
sung performance/to sing for an audience
to create/to produce/to write/creative work/creation/CL:個|个[ge4]
to sing opera music (without staging or make up)
